verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
niśamyetthaṁ bhagavataḥ
kṛṣṇasyākuṇtha-medhasaḥ
vaco duranvayaṁ viprās
tūṣṇīm āsan bhramad-dhiyaḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; niśamya—hearing; ittham—such; bhagavataḥ—of the Supreme Lord; kṛṣṇasya—Kṛṣṇa; akuṇṭha—unrestricted; medhasaḥ—whose wisdom; vacaḥ—the words; duranvayam—difficult to comprehend; viprāḥ—the learned brāhmaṇas; tūṣṇīm—silent; āsan—were; bhramat—unsteady; dhiyaḥ—their minds.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Hearing such unfathomable words from the unlimitedly wise Lord Kṛṣṇa, the learned brāhmaṇas remained silent, their minds bewildered.
